Package game.platforms

Class FallingSpike

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.DynamicBody
game.platforms.FallingSpike
All Implemented Interfaces:
city.cs.engine.CollisionListener, city.cs.engine.SensorListener, city.cs.engine.StepListener, EventListener
public class FallingSpike extends city.cs.engine.DynamicBody implements city.cs.engine.SensorListener, city.cs.engine.StepListener, city.cs.engine.CollisionListener
A spike that remains stationary until the player moves underneath, then drops straight down and deals 2 points of damage on collision.

  • Constructor Details

    • FallingSpike

      public FallingSpike(city.cs.engine.World world, float x, float y, Player player)
      Parameters:
      world - the physics world
      x - horizontal position of spike and trigger zone
      y - vertical base position before falling
      player - reference to the player to inflict damage

  • Method Details

    • beginContact

      public void beginContact(city.cs.engine.SensorEvent e)
      Called when the player enters the sensor zone beneath the spike. Activates the spike to start falling.
      Specified by:
      beginContact in interface city.cs.engine.SensorListener
      Parameters:
      e - The sensor event triggered by the player.

    • endContact

      public void endContact(city.cs.engine.SensorEvent e)
      Called when the player leaves the sensor zone beneath the spike. No action is performed in this implementation.
      Specified by:
      endContact in interface city.cs.engine.SensorListener
      Parameters:
      e - The sensor event triggered by the player.

    • preStep

      public void preStep(city.cs.engine.StepEvent e)
      Locks the horizontal velocity of the spike during its fall. Ensures the spike only moves vertically.
      Specified by:
      preStep in interface city.cs.engine.StepListener
      Parameters:
      e - The step event containing the time step information.

    • postStep

      public void postStep(city.cs.engine.StepEvent e)
      Performs any necessary actions after each physics step. This implementation does not require any post-step actions.
      Specified by:
      postStep in interface city.cs.engine.StepListener
      Parameters:
      e - The step event containing the time step information.

    • collide

      public void collide(city.cs.engine.CollisionEvent e)
      Handles the collision between the falling spike and the player. Inflicts damage to the player and destroys the spike after contact.
      Specified by:
      collide in interface city.cs.engine.CollisionListener
      Parameters:
      e - The collision event triggered by the spike and the player.
